column4: im using livecd 10.04 I have installed in hdd but does not boot.(dual boot with win7) Any help booting 10.4 in hard disk?
did you install win7 first ?
krishphillips, I do not remember. I installed from this live cd. Probably yes.
copernic I installed win7 first.
krishphillips hey this tab autofill thing does not work in livecd. ok I installed win7 first.
hmmz, strange, you need to fix your grub installation,  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
krishphi... I partitioned leaving free space with win7 then partitioned again freespace with gpart.
copernic I shall see that
wait, I'm looking for some more easy tutorial
do you get an error or does it just plainly start win7?
I think this is what you need http://www.webupd8.org/2009/12/how-to-recover-grub2-linux.html
I'm trying to play enemy territory, but my sound doesnt work, I changed the sound dev from /dev/dsp to /dev/adsp, but now it says it's muted :(
with /dev/dsp ET said it was busy, isn't this a multi channel device ?

copernic, sorry for delay I was reading the site. now, my boot straight goes to win7. I do not get any error. The MBR is a good win7 controlled. I also disabled lucid from tampering MBR. however, I think I redirected the GRUB boot record to be written in its partition itself.
you need grub to boot from linux, so you have to alter the MBR or make a boot disk maybe
anyways if you follow that last tutorial, which is streight to the point, you shouldnt have any problems
dont be scared to let grub controle the MBR, you can always reverse it by booting from the win7 cd and get the console and type fixmbr
oh wait it has changed, to reverse a grub install do this: http://www.ehow.com/how_4836283_repair-mbr-windows.html
but now you can do this : http://www.webupd8.org/2009/12/how-to-recover-grub2-linux.html :)
!alsa
what audio device should I use for games since /dev/dsp is busy ?
what audio device should I use for games since /dev/dsp is busy/not working ?
thanks for all the effort to help me. I am getting the installation fixed soon. and bye for now.
np, pay it forward ;-)
